H0.text: Stress due to the movement of Earth's crustal plates is the most likely cause of an earthquake that occurs in western Nevada.

H1.text: Gravitational variation due to the Moon's orbit around Earth is the most likely cause of an earthquake occurring in western Nevada.

H2.text: Temperature variation due to Earth's orbit around the Sun is the most likely cause of the earthquake that occurs in western Nevada.

H3.text: Rotational imbalance due to changes in the location of Earth's poles is the most likely cause of an earthquake that occurs in western Nevada.

A4.text: Earthquakes are caused mostly by the rupture of geological faults but also by other events such as volcanic activity, landslides, mine blasts, fracking and nuclear tests.

A5.text: Tectonic earthquakes occur anywhere on the earth where there is sufficient stored elastic strain energy to drive fracture propagation along a fault plane.
